page.title: 05NEWPORT HARBOUR
page.content: In 1875 Newport Harbour was extended at the expense of the railway companies in return for a right of way across the harbour. In 1981 the main cargo services between Newport and the mainland were suspended, and at the present time the only cargo transported is fertilizer which is brought in between Christmas and March. Newport Harbour is under the jurisdiction of Medina Borough Council and is under the control of the Harbour Master whose authority extends up the River Medina as far as the Folly Yachting Centre and the Cement Mills landing. The River Medina is tidal and at spring tides affords only 9ft of water. Only vessels of shallow draught can avail themselves of the facilities.
